title: Mexico hit with relentless, deadly heatwave
summary: At least 61 deaths in Mexico have been attributed to the calamitous heat wave that has baked the country for over a month, authorities said on Monday, with record-breaking temperatures exacting a severe toll on both human life and the natural environment.

title: Hamas considers positively Israel's offer for a six-week ceasefire, Biden says
summary: Hamas said it "considers positively" an Israeli roadmap towards a full Gaza ceasefire announced by US President Joe Biden, who urged an end to the almost eight-month war.

title: In French Parliament, tempers flare at every mention of hot-button Israel-Palestine issue
summary: A lawmaker was suspended for two weeks after brandishing a Palestinian flag in the Assemblée Nationale. Whenever the Israel-Hamas war is mentioned, accusations fly thick and fast, and anything more nuanced is ignored.

title: Standard & Poor's downgrades France's credit rating from AA to AA-
summary: The move, announced on Friday, May 31, 2024, is a setback for Emmanuel Macron's government, which has been struggling to rein in the country's budget deficit and revive economic growth after years of stagnation.

title: ChatGPT: 'The Achilles heel of artificial intelligence is its energy consumption'
summary: The goal of phasing out coal as part of the transition to cleaner energy sources is clashing with the soaring electricity demands of the data centers required for the development of artificial intelligence, explains economic columnist Philippe Escande.

title: India: YouTube has become the last bastion of freedom of expression
summary: With India's democracy in the grip of Narendra Modi, who is seeking another term in office, the prime minister's detractors, like the young Dhruv Rathee, have sought refuge on the video publishing platform.

title: Geneva International Auto Show closes shop after 119 years
summary: The Swiss salon, which was once the car industry’s most important European event, will be canceled after disappointing participation by auto brands and visitors.

title: 'Germany is irritated by Emmanuel Macron's portrayal of himself as Europe's leader'
summary: The longstanding Franco-German alliance that has driven the European Union forward appears to have stalled, with Germany's transatlantic leanings and reluctance to see France exercise military leadership as the sole nuclear power in the bloc hindering progress, contends Germany specialist Jacques-Pierre Gougeon, in an op-ed for 'Le Monde.'

title: An 'Islamist-inspired' attack targeting an Olympic event has been foiled, says Interior Ministry
summary: An 18-year-old Chechen was arrested in southeast France, according to the ministry's press release, which stated this was the 'first foiled attack' on the Paris Olympic Games. The suspect has been indicted and imprisoned, according to the anti-terrorist prosecutor's office.

title: Mexico, the new paradise for cosmetics companies
summary: At Walmart, El Palacio de Hierro and Sephora, Mexican women, whose employment rate is rising, are spending more and more on hair care, makeup and perfume. While highly competitive, this market is helping French company L'Oréal to expand.

title: Trump vows to appeal criminal conviction
summary: The former American president vowed to appeal his criminal conviction for falsifying business records, saying that his legal team had several grounds to challenge the verdict handed down by a New York jury

title: The new pro-Israeli clothes of Europe's far right
summary: While Israel does not officially maintain relations with many European far-right parties, many of them have become unconditional supporters of the country.

title: Geneviève de Galard, the 'Angel of Dien Bien Phu,' dies at 99
summary: The staunch Catholic was an air transport nurse in the hell of the First Indochina War. Celebrated at the end of the conflict for her courage and self-sacrifice, then gradually forgotten, Geneviève de Galard died on Thursday, May 30.

title: France bans Israeli firms from upcoming defense fair
summary: Organizers have said that Israel will not have a stand at the Eurosatory 2024 trade show near Paris, after a decision by French government authorities. No reason was given.

title: 'This is not Rafah': Image shared more than 47 million times raises questions
summary: An image supposed to represent a camp for displaced people in Rafah, likely generated by AI,  is circulating widely on social media. Le Monde spoke with digital media expert Laurence Allard to understand why it took off.

title: Donald Trump found guilty on all counts in historic hush-money trial
summary: The former US president was found guilty of falsifying business records by a New York jury in a hush-money case on Thursday. The effects Trump's historic conviction will have on the US elections in November remain unclear.

title: Donald Trump found guilty: Friday's front pages
summary: The historic conviction of the former US President for falsifying business records in the hush-money case made headlines in the United States and beyond.

title: Democratic Senator Joe Manchin registers as independent, citing 'partisan extremism'
summary: Manchin, who would have faced a tough reelection in November if he had chosen to run, has long been an outspoken critic of the Democratic Party and an obstacle to many of President Biden's legislative priorities

title: Outcry in Morocco after Netanyahu presents map of kingdom without Western Sahara on French TV
summary: Even though the Israeli prime minister has recognized Rabat's sovereignty over this territory, Moroccan newspapers see it as a provocation.

title: Japan: $300 mn bitcoin lost in 'leak'
summary: Despite their growing popularity, cryptocurrencies have a history of scandal and sudden price collapses. Thieves stole 850,000 bitcoins from the Japanese exchange Mt. Gox in 2014. It was worth around $470 million at the time.

title: Nicky Doll, presenter of France's 'Drag Race': 'When I'm in drag, there's no stopping me'
summary: Ambassador of an art form as glamorous as it is activist, drag queen Nicky Doll, whose real name is Karl Sanchez, is the mistress of ceremonies for 'Drag Race France,' season 3 of which will be broadcast from May 31.

title: French schools see anti-Semitism and racism expressed increasingly earlier: 'There are no longer any taboos'
summary: Since the October 7, 2023 Hamas terrorist attack in Israel, the French education ministry has recorded some 1,450 racist and anti-Semitic acts, among all ages. This phenomenon has been underway for several years, and now reaches as early as elementary school.

title: Conspiracy or rule of law: Trump and Biden each try to exploit the New York verdict in their own way
summary: The day after his conviction in the Stormy Daniels hush money trial, the former US president presented himself as the sacrificial victim of a 'fascist state.' In contrast, the current American leader applauded the smooth running of institutions.

title: Michelle Obama's mother Marian Robinson dies at 86
summary: Robinson lived in the White House with the first family, helping care for her young granddaughters and providing a stabilizing presence in one of the world's most stressful residences.
